Package com.att.api.aab.manager

The Address Book SDK is an Android library for natively consuming the RESTful resources for Address Book API.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
AabManager This class encapsulates the AT&T RESTful APIs for AddressBook.
 

Package com.att.api.aab.manager Description

The Address Book SDK is an Android library for natively consuming the RESTful resources of Address Book API. The SDK provides the wrapper file AabManager.java, which uses the Android public abstract class AsyncTask to handle network tasks (like HTTP requests) in the background, while providing an abstract layer with a common interface for accessing the RESTful resources in the AddressBook API.

There are two main components to the library:

  • A manager (HTTP client) to handle all the Address Book requests.
  • A set of request wrappers for the HTTP requests to access the RESTful resources of the Address Book API.

Request wrappers:

The SDK provides wrappers which expose the main request parameters for the following RESTful resources that can be accessed by an application.

  • CreateContact
  • GetContacts
  • GetContact
  • GetContactGroups
  • UpdateContact
  • DeleteContact
  • CreateGroup
  • GetGroups
  • DeleteGroup
  • UpdateGroup
  • AddContactsToGroup
  • RemoveContactsFromGroup
  • GetGroupContacts
  • GetMyInfo
  • UpdateMyInfo

The networking layer is abstracted away by providing the AabManager to handle the requests made by the application. AabManager calls the service, which creates the actual HTTP requests in the background tasks by using the Android public abstract class AsyncTask. Network calls are not allowed in the main UI thread from Android API level 11 onwards, hence the calls are handled in the AsyncTasks. The developer may define success and error callbacks using listeners.

Using the Address Book SDK in your Android App:

  • Download the jar files [aabsdk.jar, codekit.jar] from the release folder and add them to the build path of your project.

Usage

  • Initialize the app client: 
    
final String domainName = "https://api.att.com";
final String clientId = " appId"; // Enter the value from 'App Key' field 
final String clientSecret = "appSecret"; // Enter the value from 'Secret' field
  • Add the UserConsentActivity class to the manifest file: 
    
 android:name="com.att.api.consentactivity.UserConsentActivity"
 android:label="@string/title_activity_user_consent" >
  • Pass the domainName, appId and appSecret as extras in the UserConsentActivity class to obtain the OAuth code from the onActivityResult callback. 
     
 Intent i = new Intent (this,com.att.api.consentactivity.UserConsentActivity.class);
 i.putExtra("fqdn", Config.fqdn);
 i.putExtra("clientId", Config.clientID);
 i.putExtra("clientSecret", Config.secretKey);
 i.putExtra("redirectUri", Config.redirectUri);
 i.putExtra("appScope", Config.appScope);
 startActivityForResult(i, OAUTH_CODE);
  • Obtain the token by passing the OAuth code in onActivityResult 
     
 aabManager = new AabManager(Config.fqdn, Config.clientID,Config.secretKey,new getTokenListener());
 aabManager.getOAuthToken(oAuthCode);
  • You can call other APIs upon successful call back of the token listener, for example: 
     
 public class getTokenListener implements AttSdkListener {
 
 public void onSuccess(Object response) {
 OAuthToken authToken = (OAuthToken) response;
 if (null != authToken) {
 getAddressBookContacts();
  }
 }
    
  public void onError(AttSdkError error) {
  //Your code for error        
  }
 }
    Note : You may cache the access token so that do not have to receive authorization every time the app is launched.

Input Parameters used in Address Book API :

Input parameters for some of the methods require X-Fields, Pagination Parameters, Search Parameters.

xFields: Specifies a string of comma (,) delimited Contact object field names that are expected in the response. The specified field names must match the Contact object. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

  • x-fields: shallow -- Returns the QuickContact Data model. If one or more search parameters are present in the request, then the x-fields value should be set to shallow.
  • x-fields: {{field names from Contact object with comma separated values}}
  • x-fields:{{empty value}}or no x-field header parameter, Returns all of the contacts will all of the attributes.

    Note: AT&T recommends that only one of the above x-fields parameter values should be specified. Combining options 1, 2, 3 are invalid. Return full contact object for this condition. If a request contains search parameters and any value for the x- fields parameter, then the default value for the x-fields is shallow [x-fields: shallow] and it should be set in the request without returning any exception.

Pagination Parameters :
  • Specifies the sorting order of the output. Acceptable values for this parameter are:
    • ASC: ascending (Default)
    • DESC: descending.
  • Specifies the field name to be used for ordering the output.
  • Specifies the value of the limit. This parameter value must be set to one (1) or greater. The default value is 10.
  • Specifies the value of the offset. This parameter value must be set to zero (0) or greater. The default value is 0. If pagination contains invalid parameters, this method will return an empty list
Search Parameters
  • formattedName : Specifies formatted name.
  • firstName : Specifies the first name of the contact.
  • lastName : Specifies the middle name of the contact
  • nickName : Specifies the alternate name or familiar form of proper name
  • email : Specifies the e-mail addresses associated with the contact such as official mail address, personal mail address etc.
  • phone : Specifies the phone numbers associated with the contacts, such as Personal phone number, office phone number.
  • organization : Specifies the organization name.
  • addressLine1 : Specifies the first line of a street address for a contact.
  • addressLine2 : Specifies the second line of a street address for a contact, if applicable.
  • city : Specifies the city.
  • zipcode : Specifies the zip code.

Data structures used in Address Book API :

AT&T Mobile customer’s Contact object: if x-fields: no-value or x-fields: attribute names.

Contact data structure:

  • contactId: Specifies the customer's contact unique identifier(ID). The contact ID value must not be passed in the create/update contact operation
  • creationDate: Specifies the date and time when the contact was created. This field must not be passed in the create/update contact operation.
  • modificationDate: Specifies the date and time when the contact was last modified. This field must not be passed in the create/update contact operation.
  • formattedName: Specifies formatted name. This field must not be passed in the create/update contact operation.
  • firstName: Specifies the first name of the contact.
  • middleName: Specifies the middle name of the contact.
  • lastName: Specifies the last name of the contact.
  • prefix: Specifies the name prefix.
  • suffix: Specifies the name suffix.
  • nickname: Specifies the alternate name or familiar form of a proper name.
  • organization: Specifies the organization name.
  • jobTitle: Specifies the job title of the contact.
  • anniversary: Specifies a date for honouring a significant social commitment. The acceptable format for this parameter is mm/dd/yyyy.
  • gender: Specifies the gender of the contact. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
    • Male
    • Female
  • spouse: Specifies the name of a spouse or domestic partner.
  • children: Specifies the names of a contact's children, in a comma separated list with no limit to the number of allowed names.
  • hobby: Specifies the hobbies of a contact, in a comma separated list. The maximum number of values for a contact is 3.
  • assistant: Specifies the names of the assistants of the contact, in a comma separated list. The maximum number of values for a contact is 3.
  • phones: Contains the phone numbers associated with the contact; such as personal phone number, office phone number, and so on. The maximum number of values for a contact is 8.
  • addresses: Contains the addresses associated with the contact; such as home address, office address, and so on. The maximum number of values for a contact is 4.
  • emails: Contains the e-mail addresses associated with the contact; such as official e-mail address, personal e-mail address, and so on. The maximum number of values for a contact is 4.
  • ims: Contains the instant messenger (IM) addresses associated with the contact. The maximum number of values for a contact is 4.
  • weburls: Contains the uniform resource locators (URLs) associated with the contact. The maximum number of values for a contact is 3.
  • photo: Contains the contact’s photograph.

AT&T Mobile customer's QuickContact object: if x-fields: shallow

Quick Contact data structure:

  • contactId: Specifies Contact unique identifier.
  • formattedName: Specifies formatted name.
  • firstName: Specifies the first name of the contact.
  • middleName: Specifies the middle name of the contact.
  • lastName: Specifies the last name of the contact
  • prefix: Specifies the name prefix
  • suffix: Specifies the name suffix
  • nickname: Specifies the alternate name or familiar form of a proper name.
  • organization: Specifies the organization name. Mandatory if contact type is Business
  • phone: Specifies the list of phone numbers associated with the contacts, such as personal phone number, office phone number etc.
  • email: Specifies the list of e-mail addresses associated with the contact such as official mail address, personal mail address etc.
  • im: Specifies the list of Instant Messenger addresses.
  • address: Specifies the list of addresses associated with contact such as home address, office address etc.

Group data structure:

  • groupId: Specifies the group identifier(ID).
  • groupName: Specifies the name of the group.Group names are case insensitive.
  • groupType: Specifies the type of the group. This acceptable values for this parameter are:
    • SYSTEM
    • USER

    Note : If a type different from USER is present in a group, it will be ignored and reset to USER by default.

Address data structure:

  • type: Specifies the address type of a contact. The acceptable values for this parameter are :
    • HOME
    • WORK
    • NO VALUE
  • preferred: Indicates that the address type is the preferred address of a contact.
  • poBox: Specifies the post office box number of a contact, if applicable.
  • addressLine1: Specifies the first line of a street address for a contact.
  • addressLine2: Specifies the second line of a street address for a contact, if applicable.
  • city: Specifies the city of a contact.
  • state: Specifies the state in the address of a contact.
  • zipcode: Specifies the zip code of a contact.
  • country: Specifies the country of a contact.

Email data structure:

  • type: Specifies the e-mail address type of a contact. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
    • INTERNET
    • INTERNET,WORK
    • INTERNET,HOME
    • NO VALUE
  • emailAddress: Specifies the e-mail address of a contact.
  • preferred: Indicates that the e-mail address of a contact is the preferred e-mail address.

IM data structure:

  • type: Specifies one of the predefined types of instant messaging (IM) used by a contact and the IM location or a combination of the two values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
    • AIM
    • GTALK
    • HOME
    • HOME,AIM
    • HOME,GTALK
    • HOME,ICQ
    • HOME,JABBER
    • HOME,MSN
    • HOME,SKYPE
    • HOME,WV
    • HOME,YAHOO
    • ICQ
    • JABBER
    • MSN
    • SKYPE
    • WORK
    • WORK,AIM
    • WORK,GTALK
    • WORK,ICQ
    • WORK,JABBER
    • WORK,MSN
    • WORK,SKYPE
    • WORK,WV
    • WORK,YAHOO
    • WV
    • YAHOO
  • imUri: Specifies the URI for the IM.
  • preferred: Indicates that the specified IM type and location are preferred for the contact.

Phone data structure:

  • type: Specifies the type of phone number. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
    • CELL
    • HOME,CELL
    • WORK,CELL
    • VOICE
    • HOME,VOICE
    • WORK,VOICE
    • FAX
    • HOME,FAX
    • WORK,FAX
    • VIDEO
    • HOME,VIDEO
    • WORK,VIDEO
    • PAGER
    • CAR
    • OTHER
    • NO VALUE
  • number: Specifies the telephone number.
  • preferred: Indicates that the phone number is the preferred phone for a contact.

GroupResultSet data structure:

  • totalRecords: Specifies the total number of group records returned.
  • totalPages: Specifies the total number of pages returned.
  • currentPageIndex: Specifies the index of the current page.
  • previousPage: Specifies the page prior to the current page.
  • nextPage: Specifies the page following the current page.
  • Group[]: Group data structure

ContactResultSet data structure:

  • totalRecords: Specifies the total number of records returned.
  • totalPages: Specifies the total number of pages returned.
  • currentPageIndex: Specifies the index of the current page.
  • previousPage: Specifies the page prior to the current page.
  • nextPage: Specifies the page following the current page.
  • Contact[]: Contact data structure
  • QuickContact[]: QuickContact data structure

Since:
1.0
